Class Polygon

java.lang.Object
  Polygon

public class Polygon
extends java.lang.Object

Judy Isaacs and Joyce Vogel This class represents a "Convex Polygon" in the plane

Constructor Summary

          Creates an empty polygon.

Constructor Detail

Polygon

public Polygon()
Creates an empty polygon.

Method Detail

addVertex

public boolean addVertex(int x,
                         int y)
Adds a new Point to the Polygon with the given x and y values

Parameters:
x - the specified x coordinate
y - the specified y coordinate
Returns:
true if the point was added successfully; false otherwise.

calcArea

public double calcArea()
Calculates and returns the area of the Polygon. In the event that the Polygon has less than 3 verticies, it returns 0.

Returns:
the area of the Polygon if the Polygon has 3 or more verticies; otherwise 0.

calcPerimeter

public double calcPerimeter()
Calculates and returns the perimeter of the Polygon. In the event that there are only 2 verticies, it calculates the distance of the line represented by the two verticies. In the event that there are less than 2 verticies it returns 0.

Returns:
the perimeter of the Polygon if the Polygon has 3 or more verticies; otherwise if it has 2 verticies returns the distance between the verticies; otherwise 0.

findVertex

public int findVertex(Point p)
Finds and returns the index of a vertex.

Parameters:
p - the Point whose index will be returned
Returns:
the index of p if the Point exists in the Polygon; otherwise-1

getBoundingBox

public Polygon getBoundingBox()
Calculates and returns a Polygon which represents the bounding box of this Polygon. The bounding box is the smallest Rectangle whose sides are parallel to the x and y axes of the coordinate space, and can completely contain the Polygon.

Returns:
a Polygon (in the shape of a rectangle) that defines the bounds of this Polygon

getNextVertex

public Point getNextVertex(Point p)
Finds and returns a copy of the successor of a Point in the Polygon.

Parameters:
p - the Point whose successor will be returned
Returns:
the successor of p if Point exists in the Polygon; otherwise null

highestVertex

public Point highestVertex()
Finds and returns a copy of the highest Point on the Polygon if such a point exists. If it does not exist, returns null. In the event that more than one such point exists, it returns the first point it finds.

Returns:
a Point which represents the highest vertex on the polygon if such a point exists; false otherwise.

isBigger

public boolean isBigger(Polygon other)
Determines whether or not the area of Polygon is bigger than the area of the instance of Polygon it is to be compared with.

Parameters:
other - an object to be compared with this Polygon
Returns:
true if this Polygon has an area larger than the object to be compared with; false otherwise

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this Polygon.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a string representation of this Polygon
